categories.name: LLM Development and Alignment
categories.description: Research on the effect of architecture, training, and alignment of LLM on the safety of AI.

categories.name: AI for Security
categories.description: Research on using AI to enhance traditional cybersecurity, threat detection, and incident response.

categories.name: LLM Reasoning
categories.description: Techniques for improving model reasoning, consistency, and alignment with human goals.

categories.name: AI Safety
categories.description: Ensuring models behave as intended, avoiding harms such as bias, toxicity, and unsafe outputs.

categories.name: AI Security
categories.description: Defenses and attacks on AI models, including adversarial prompts and jailbreaks that aims to target the AI system.

categories.name: AI Robustness
categories.description: Robustness of AI models to distribution shifts and unexpected inputs.

categories.name: Privacy and Data Protection
categories.description: Techniques for protecting sensitive data against leakage, memorization, and extraction.

categories.name: Agent Security
categories.description: Security of LLM-based agents, covering memory, tool use, planning, and multi-agent risks.

categories.name: Human Factors in AI Security
categories.description: Study of human-AI interaction, trust, usability, and social implications of AI systems.

categories.name: Governance, Ethics, and Policy
categories.description: Regulatory frameworks, ethical guidelines, and governance for AI security and safety.

categories.name: Evaluation and Benchmarks
categories.description: Methods and datasets for evaluating safety, robustness, and security in AI systems.

categories.name: Computational Social Science and Cultural Analytics
categories.description: NLP methods for analyzing human behavior, culture, stance, bias, misinformation, and social interaction.

categories.name: Dialogue and Interactive Systems
categories.description: Research on dialogue systems, evaluation, reasoning, bias, factuality, retrieval, and multimodal interaction.

categories.name: Discourse and Pragmatics
categories.description: Studies of coherence, cohesion, anaphora, coreference, discourse relations, and argumentation.

categories.name: Efficient and Low-Resource NLP
categories.description: Techniques for quantization, pruning, distillation, efficient training, and resource-constrained NLP.

categories.name: Ethics, Bias, and Fairness
categories.description: Evaluation and mitigation of bias, fairness, ethics, transparency, and governance in NLP.

categories.name: Text Generation
categories.description: Research on text generation, evaluation, multilingualism, adaptation, retrieval-augmented methods, and architectures.

categories.name: Human-Centered NLP
categories.description: Design and evaluation of NLP with human-in-the-loop, participatory methods, and value-sensitive design.

categories.name: Information Extraction
categories.description: Entity and relation extraction, event extraction, knowledge base construction, and multilingual IE.

categories.name: Information Retrieval and Text Mining
categories.description: Retrieval, dense representations, ranking, and contrastive learning for text mining and search.

categories.name: Interpretability and Model Analysis
categories.description: Interpretability methods, adversarial analysis, calibration, probing, robustness, and model editing.

categories.name: Language Modeling
categories.description: Research on pretraining, prompting, safety, reasoning, scaling, agents, robustness, and red teaming.

categories.name: Linguistic Theories and Psycholinguistics
categories.description: Computational models of language theories, cognition, and psycholinguistic phenomena.

categories.name: Machine Learning for NLP
categories.description: Learning methods for NLP, including self-supervision, multitask, meta learning, causality, and optimization.

categories.name: Machine Translation
categories.description: Models and methods for multilingual MT, efficiency, evaluation, adaptation, speech translation, and deployment.

categories.name: Multilingual and Cross-Lingual NLP
categories.description: Cross-lingual transfer, multilingual pretraining, less-resourced and endangered languages, and tools.

categories.name: Multimodality and Language Grounding
categories.description: Integration of language with vision, robotics, speech, and cross-modal tasks like VQA and navigation.

categories.name: NLP Applications
categories.description: Practical applications of NLP in education, healthcare, finance, legal, social good, and code generation.

categories.name: Phonology, Morphology, and Word Segmentation
categories.description: Research on morphology, phonology, word segmentation, pronunciation, and linguistic analysis.

categories.name: Question Answering
categories.description: QA across domains including commonsense, multihop, biomedical, math, multilingual, and conversational QA.

categories.name: Resources and Evaluation
categories.description: Corpus creation, benchmarking, dataset design, evaluation metrics, reproducibility, and testing methods.

categories.name: Lexical and Sentence-Level Semantics
categories.description: Research on entailment, semantic similarity, compositionality, embeddings, paraphrasing, and NLI.

categories.name: Sentiment, Style, and Argument Mining
categories.description: Stance detection, sentiment, stylistics, argument quality, framing, and generation of argumentative text.

categories.name: Speech and Spoken Language Understanding
categories.description: ASR, TTS, spoken dialogue, speech-grounded understanding, and multimodal speech technologies.

categories.name: Summarization
categories.description: Research on extractive, abstractive, conversational, multimodal, multilingual, and long-form summarization.

categories.name: Syntax and Parsing
categories.description: Part-of-speech tagging, parsing algorithms, morpho-syntax, semantic parsing, and multilingual parsing.

categories.name: Learning Paradigms
categories.description: Core approaches to machine learning including supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning.

categories.name: Active Learning
categories.description: Methods where models query or select informative samples to improve learning efficiency.

categories.name: Online Learning
categories.description: Incremental model updates as new data arrives, without retraining from scratch.

categories.name: One-Shot and Low-Shot Learning
categories.description: Techniques for learning from very few labeled examples.

categories.name: Semi-Supervised Learning
categories.description: Learning with limited labeled data combined with large amounts of unlabeled data.

categories.name: Unsupervised Learning
categories.description: Discovering hidden patterns, clusters, or latent structures in unlabeled data.

categories.name: Transfer and Multitask Learning
categories.description: Leveraging knowledge from one domain or task to improve learning in another.

categories.name: Learning to Learn
categories.description: Algorithms that learn across tasks, enabling adaptation with minimal new data.

categories.name: Reinforcement Learning
categories.description: Learning from interaction with environments via rewards and penalties.

categories.name: Model-Based RL
categories.description: Reinforcement learning methods that explicitly model environment dynamics.

categories.name: Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
categories.description: RL involving multiple agents with cooperative or competitive objectives.

categories.name: Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
categories.description: Structured RL with temporal abstractions and sub-task hierarchies.

categories.name: Bandit Algorithms
categories.description: Exploration-exploitation algorithms for decision-making under uncertainty.

categories.name: Causal Inference
categories.description: Methods for discovering and reasoning about cause-and-effect relationships.

categories.name: Models and Architectures
categories.description: Design of neural networks, generative models, and probabilistic frameworks.

categories.name: Attention Models
categories.description: Mechanisms for focusing computation on relevant parts of the input.

categories.name: Recurrent Networks
categories.description: Neural models with feedback connections for sequential data.

categories.name: Generative Models
categories.description: Models that learn to generate data, including VAEs, GANs, and autoregressive models.

categories.name: Adversarial Networks
categories.description: Generative adversarial models trained with competing objectives.

categories.name: Memory-Augmented Neural Networks
categories.description: Neural architectures with external or structured memory components.

categories.name: Hierarchical Models
categories.description: Models that represent data at multiple levels of abstraction.

categories.name: Graphical Models
categories.description: Probabilistic models such as Bayesian networks and factor graphs.

categories.name: Variational Inference
categories.description: Approximate inference methods using optimization over distributions.

categories.name: Gaussian Processes
categories.description: Nonparametric Bayesian models for regression and classification.

categories.name: Latent Variable Models
categories.description: Models with hidden variables explaining observed data.

categories.name: Embedding Approaches
categories.description: Representing entities such as words, images, or graphs in vector spaces.

categories.name: Components Analysis
categories.description: Methods such as PCA, ICA, LDA, and CCA for dimensionality reduction.

categories.name: Optimization and Training
categories.description: Mathematical and algorithmic methods for training AI models efficiently.

categories.name: Convex Optimization
categories.description: Optimization techniques for convex functions with guaranteed solutions.

categories.name: Non-Convex Optimization
categories.description: Optimization of complex landscapes typical in deep networks.

categories.name: Stochastic Methods
categories.description: Randomized algorithms for optimization and inference.

categories.name: Regularization
categories.description: Techniques to prevent overfitting and improve generalization.

categories.name: Sparsity and Compressed Sensing
categories.description: Learning under sparsity constraints and compressed representations.

categories.name: Spectral Methods
categories.description: Algorithms based on eigenvalues and spectral graph properties.

categories.name: Optimization for Deep Networks
categories.description: Techniques to improve convergence and performance in deep learning.

categories.name: Hyperparameter Selection
categories.description: Methods for tuning model parameters efficiently.

categories.name: Applications and Domains
categories.description: Use of AI methods in specific application areas and interdisciplinary domains.

categories.name: Computer Vision
categories.description: Visual perception tasks such as recognition, detection, and segmentation.

categories.name: Speech and Audio Processing
categories.description: Automatic speech recognition, TTS, and auditory modeling.

categories.name: Natural Language Processing
categories.description: Processing and generation of human language in text and speech.

categories.name: Robotics
categories.description: AI methods for perception, planning, navigation, and control in robots.

categories.name: Computational Biology and Neuroscience
categories.description: AI applications in bioinformatics, brain mapping, connectomics, and neuroprostheses.

categories.name: Quantitative Finance and Econometrics
categories.description: AI and ML applications in financial modeling, risk, and econometrics.

categories.name: Computational Social Science
categories.description: Modeling human behavior, social networks, and cultural phenomena with AI.

categories.name: Recommender Systems
categories.description: Algorithms for ranking, preference learning, and personalization.

categories.name: Game Playing and Game Theory
categories.description: AI in strategic environments and multi-agent decision-making.

categories.name: Privacy, Anonymity, and Security
categories.description: Ensuring AI systems protect sensitive data and resist adversarial threats.

categories.name: Software Toolkits
categories.description: Libraries, benchmarks, and frameworks for AI research and applications.
